page.title: 13FAMOUS BUILDINGS
page.content:
Worksop boasts several buildings of note. There is the Priory Church, built in 1103 by the Normans. This church has been added to in the 12th., 13th. and 20th. centuries.
Associated with the Priory is the Gate House which at one time used to have a road passing through it. This road was diverted in 1891 to preserve the building.
In the market place there is the Old Ship Inn, one of Worksop's oldest pubs. It is believed to have been built in the 16th. or 17th. century.
At the top of Bridge Street is a chemist which has a licence to sell alcohol in its cellars.
